comments:
In 3.1M7, to reproduce:
1. Install the Ruby Development Tools plugin from
http://rubyeclipse.sourceforge.net/updatesite/
2. Switch the the Ruby perspective
3. In the Ruby Resource view right-click New > Ruby Project.

Nothing happens.  Notice the "java.lang.NullPointerException at
org.eclipse.jface.resource.DeviceResourceManager.allocate(DeviceResourceManager.java:56)"
(the entire stack trace is at the bottom of this description).

I didn't see any non-org.eclipse.* package names in the stacktrace leading me to
believe this may be a scenario the Eclipse runtime should better anticipate.

The entire stack trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
Moving to UI, but you might consider reporting to Ruby as well.

I think the bug is in Window.getDefaultPageImage(). defaultImageDescriptor can
be null, but it doesn't check for this.  This causes the NPE higher up the stack.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 90453 ***
